data.title: Low-code programming for event-driven applications : Node-RED
data.content:
Low-code programming for event-driven applications : Node-RED
===============           

[Node-RED](https://nodered.org/)

*   [home](https://nodered.org/)
*   [about](https://nodered.org/about/)
*   [blog](https://nodered.org/blog/)
*   [documentation](https://nodered.org/docs/)
*   [forum](https://discourse.nodered.org/)
*   [flows](https://flows.nodered.org/)
*   [github](https://github.com/node-red)

[](https://nodered.org/#)

Low-code programming for event-driven applications
==================================================

The easiest way to collect, transform and visualize real-time data.
-------------------------------------------------------------------

Latest version: [v4.0.9 (npm)](https://www.npmjs.com/package/node-red)

[Get Started](https://nodered.org/#get-started)

![Image 1](https://nodered.org/images/nr-image-1.png)

Node-RED's goal is to enable anyone to build applications that collect, transform and visualize their data; building flows that can automate their world. Its low-code nature makes it accessible to users of any background, whether for home automation, industrial control systems or anything in between.

From home hobbyists to large scale industrial operations, Node-RED has found a place in a wide range of applications, supported by an active community that has built over [5,000 Nodes and Flows](https://flows.nodered.org/) to help you get started quickly.

![Image 2](https://nodered.org/images/nr-image-2.png)

### Get Started

Node-RED is built on Node.js, taking full advantage of its event-driven, non-blocking model. This makes it ideal to run at the edge of the network on low-cost hardware such as the Raspberry Pi as well as in the cloud.

![Image 3](https://nodered.org/images/platform-local.png)

#### Run locally

*   [Getting started](https://nodered.org/docs/getting-started/)
*   [Docker](https://nodered.org/docs/platforms/docker)

![Image 4](https://nodered.org/images/platform-device.png)

#### On a device

*   [Raspberry Pi](https://nodered.org/docs/hardware/raspberrypi)
*   [BeagleBone Black](https://nodered.org/docs/hardware/beagleboneblack)
*   [Interacting with Arduino](https://nodered.org/docs/hardware/arduino)
*   [Android](https://nodered.org/docs/platforms/android)

![Image 5](https://nodered.org/images/platform-cloud.png)

#### In the cloud

*   [FlowFuse](https://flowfuse.com/)
*   [Amazon Web Services](https://nodered.org/docs/platforms/aws)
*   [Microsoft Azure](https://nodered.org/docs/platforms/azure)

The creators of Node-RED, who continue to lead the project today.
